sentences: Ta hoolitseb oma keha heas seisundis.
context: The Estonian verb 'hoolitsen' means to care for, take care of, or look after someone or something. It can refer to caring for people (children, family members), animals, or things (one's body, home, garden). The word implies providing necessary attention and maintaining good condition. When used with '-n' ending as in 'hoolitsen', it is the first person singular present form meaning 'I care for/take care of'.
